text: Glochidion raivavense, also known by its synonym Phyllanthus raivavense or by the local name mahame on the island of Tubuai, is a species of plant in the family Phyllanthaceae.Butaud, J.-F. (2014) Rimatara, Rurutu, Tubuai, Raivavae: guide floristique. Papeete: Direction de l'Environnement, Government of French Polynesia. It is endemic to the Austral Islands in French Polynesia, where it is native to the islands of Rurutu, Tubuai, and Raivavae.Florence, J. (1997) Flore de la Polynésie française, vol. 1. Paris: Éditions de l'ORSTOM. ==References== raivavense Category:Flora of the Tubuai Islands Category:Endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Glochidion raivavense
